GilletteUK|557465444309962_1838219|120044624718715_557465444309962|post|Does shaving make your hair grow back thicker? Scientists at Gillette have conducted extensive testing on the effects shaving has on both male and female hair growth, texture and color. This testing has proven that shaving does not affect hair growth, color or texture. Shaving does, however, alter the tip shape of the regrown hair, which may initially change the way hair feels as it grows back. But if hair is left to re-grow completely, it will return to its former state.|-1806423305|10157917633475274|2013-07-02 13:25:14

GilletteUK|128322840593398_241893|120044624718715_128322840593398|post|Hi Hynd, probably best to make the distinction between a moisturiser and an aftershave balm, since it sounds like you might have the two confused. Yes, a balm is a moisturiser of sorts but it also contains a number of soothing and reparative ingredients to help skin recover from all the microscopic mutilation that comes with shaving. Even a ‘perfect’ shave is traumatic for the skin and so you need a dedicated balm to help rebuild the outermost layers of the skin so it’s not left totally defenseless against infection, irritation and whatever is floating about in the air that surrounds you. A balm, like – you guessed it – Gillette’s own will basically speed up the healing process. If you want to check out other brands, look for calming and reparative ingredients like Chamomile, Aloe Vera and Vitamin E. Also make sure it has as little alcohol in the formula as possible, as that will dry skin out even more. A moisturiser, on the other hand, just does the moisturising part. Cunning, eh?|GilletteUK|120044624718715|2011-08-05 14:24:48

GilletteUK|238338222873660_3473859|120044624718715_238338222873660|post|Hi Everyone, know some people are having a few problems with signing up to the Gillette League. Seem to be a few glitches with the FF tab! Sincere apologies. Incase it's due to anything other than that, just wanted to clarrify a few things. 1) The 'Fantasy Football' tab containing the info needed is on the top left side of this Wall page 2) You need to click 'Like' the Gillette page in order to access the pin code info within the tab 3) Once you've logged into Sky FF the name of the league is 'Gillette League' not just 'Gillette'. GilletteUK|120044624718715:235887176467792:10103340957361461_10101038386292370|120044624718715_235887176467792|post|Hi Kev Rottweiler Granelli, quite a few factors play a role in shaving irritation, although, it sounds like you’re doing a lot of the right things (i.e. using a scrub, quality shaving foam and razor, and moisturising). Couple of things I’d suggest which may help would be to ensure the scrub is a mild one, and rather than the hot cloth post-shave, I’d rinse with cool water and pat dry instead. Also, it's worth taking a check of your shaving technique. Make sure you’re shaving with (rather than against) the grain, using only light strokes, and not going over the same area unnecessarily - you might find moving to our ProGlide razor helps as its designed to reduce tug and pull. If you’ve not already given them a go, I’d recommend trying our new Irritation Defense products. The shaving preps, moisturisers, and balms are all designed to work together to help fight the signs of shaving irritation and sound as though they might be just the ticket for you. If you’d like, give our Care Line a call on 00800 44553883 and they’ll be able to help further by discussing things in more detail. Let me know how you go!|GilletteUK|120044624718715|2011-10-13 12:32:25

GilletteUK|1044904045566097_1047174198672415|120044624718715_1044904045566097|post|Years ago a clothes detergent came out called Radian B. It was in a bright orange box and solved the age old and unnoticed problem of our clothes stinking. Every new washing powder that came out solved another non existent flaw with the previous perfect washing powder. It's the same with these razors. Ask any professional barber and he/she will tell you that the only advantage is that the blades are at a 30 degree angle which hasn't changed since the first spring loaded cartridge razor. Once these things went past Mach 3, some even started vibrating, they became a farce so I decided to look into other options. Brush, bowl, cream and double Edge razor will save a small fortune and the only negative is a bit of practice and 5 more minutes on each shave. Give it a try. GilletteUK|128322840593398_241485|120044624718715_128322840593398|post|Oh Goose Murphy. Part of me wants to say embrace your genetics or recommend pubic wigs but they just look ridiculous. The only solution left, therefore, is to go about trimming and then shaving the area so the colour is less…impactful. Around 33% of British men have confessed to trimming downstairs but tending to the crown jewels is tricky - so pay attention! Start by cleaning the area, then powdering to soak up any excess moisture. Hair downstairs can be a little denser than elsewhere so ‘debulk’ before shaving. I’d recommend going for a pair of electric clippers with adjustable comb. That way you can just chip into the bulk of hair until you’re left with a comely five o’clock shadow. Nice. Then for the shaving! Use a razor that shaves with or against the grain and adjusts to your bodies shape. Carefully, pull the loose skin as taut as possible so that the razor doesn’t accidentally snip or tug and use light even strokes until the chaps are left completely smooth. Finish with an alcohol-free, moisturising balm and avoid getting sweaty for the next day or two, if possible. In solving your colour problem, shaving will also afford you the optical illusion of a bigger tool. It’s a win, win, scenario really. Sharkey – hope that helps you too. Our partnership with The Olympics combines this everyday purpose for our company with the Olympic aim of improving lives through sport. My advice is to try lush for their shaving products, very good and makes you smell good. Also top tip....get your pours open with hot water, I mean super super hot apply your gel/foam and shave in cold water, the cold will make your stubble stand up to be shaved and the blades will last a few extra shave's if your a daily or every other daily shaver|-1381394489|10154851908931967|2012-09-18 09:45:04
GilletteUK|128322840593398_242365|120044624718715_128322840593398|post|Ahmed has now left the building so to speak ;) Thanks to those of you that asked questions and to Ahmed for his answers! Miller – we’ll happily answer this one for you. It’s not an uncommon problem. Preparing properly and making a few changes to shaving technique are usually two areas which can make a big difference. In terms of prep: washing your face with a scrub to remove grubby build-up (i.e. dirt, oil and dead skin cells) and hydrating your face with warm water for at least 3 minutes before shaving will both help with razor glide and, therefore, comfort. As will using a non drying shave gel. In terms of technique: firstly make sure your blade is not dull and in your case always shave with the grain not against it. Use gentle strokes, no heavy handedness needed! Also, it’s a good idea to save the area around your mouth till last as this tends to be where the hair is coarsest and gives it more soaking and softening time. During the shave, rinse your blade frequently as it prevents build up in the razor, which again could hinder its glide and make things more uncomfortable. Another area that determines whether the whole experience is a comfortable affair or not, is your post shaving routine. After shaving, rinse with cool water, pat your face dry, and ensure you always use an aftershave balm. See Ahmed’s previous answer above for more info on them. Hope that all helps!|GilletteUK|120044624718715|2011-08-05 16:33:17

When blades cut hair they pull it further out of the skin. By having one blade after another, it allows the blade that follows to cut further down the hair shaft. Having multiple blades means this process is replicated giving a much closer shave. Appreciate everyone’s different though, and we do have the Sensor and Mach3 if you prefer those to get creative with.|GilletteUK|120044624718715|2012-01-19 16:52:23

GilletteUK|120044624718715:235887176467792:10103340957361461_10101038386262430|120044624718715_235887176467792|post|Lol Pip, may just take you up on that, sounds like you have superman style hair of steel ;) Although, jokes aside in some places facial hair can be as strong as copper wire to cut! The ProGlide Power you’re using is your best bet as it contains the latest advances in shaving technology and the micro-pulses will help provide as close and thorough shave for you as possible. Couple of other tips which might help are leaving certain areas of the face till last when shaving and increasing your shaving frequency. The hair around the upper lip and mouth is strongest so shave these areas last and give them the maximum soak time with the prep (at least 3 mins). Trying to keep on top of troublesome stubble can also be key. For some of us that means adding an extra shave to the day, a bit annoying but it can work a treat.
